review.review_text:
return visit after 15 years... still great

Greek restaurants are generally predictably good just based on the cuisines and the popular dishes. It's hard to excel however. Kokkari really excels and seems to have been doing so for a long time. Reservations essential. Easy walk from the Hyatt Embarcadero. Neighborhood seems safe.

Kokkari is a Restaurant that is cooking on all burners. The food is terrific, the service professional and on point. The two dining rooms are beautifully decorated and exquisitely maintained. In short, it has everything you could want in a Restaurant. It's intimate and charming for a couple, but fun and comfortable for a crowd.

Have never been disappointed in the food. Always terrific. The room can get VERY busy and loud, but if you like an "energetic" enviornment, this is the ticket. Service ranges from attentive and professional to brusque and borderline rude. Always a crap shoot.

A tremendous mix of traditional and innovative menu items, served in a very cozy atmosphere. Staff is well versed in menu, as is sommelier. Works well for intimate dinners or mid-sized group events. Location is easily accessible, parking is also available.
How could anyone rate this restaurant less than a five. The service was fantastic. The calamari appetizer was mouthwatering and revolutionary.  The lamb shank melted in my mouth.

This is a very good restaurant with outstanding Greek food. Not the type most of us are familiar with; nothing is greasy or overpowered with tzatziki.
We had feta stuffed calamari - excellent.
Lamb chops - excellent
Even the inexpensive retsina was very good.
The service was very attentive, professional and prompt.
The only negative thing I can mention is that the tables seemed to be too close to one another. 
Highly recommended; reserve way in advance, as the restaurant is in high demand.

Kokkari's is a famously wonderful restaurant and an icon in San Francisco.

My Friend and I were in the city for a couple of days, and my research lead me to a must visit. What you need to know:

DO NOT valet. They charge $15.00 (without tip)and while the valet guys were friendly, they drove our car with reckless abandon in front of us....Uber in San Francisco (taxis have a reputation for being unreliable) if you are a tourist without a car, use public transportation, or last option is to simply take advantage of the ample nearby public parking and walk.

When you make your reservation, and you will definitely need one to get in unless you dine extremely early, request the back dining room. This restaurant is huge with a vibrant bar scene, which is in the front of the restaurant. The problem with the front is that if you are a party of two, you will be seated just a few inches away from another couple. 

The rear of the restaurant is where the real action is: a lively, international crowd and clearly the place where the "insiders" go.

One of the wonderful things, besides the divine cuisine, about Kokkari's is our server made note of our preference, and the hostess entered it under our Open Table profile on our way out.

Our server was a young woman who I doubted had the ability to help us pick our a wine. And, was I happily proven wrong. She was not only attentive and knowledgable, but she picked a Greek wine for us based on our normal preferences of California and French reds. We were so impressed that we had her order an array of dishes for us, and were swooning as we ate this absolute peerless Greek food. 

Order at least 4-5 dishes off the Mezethes menu & share. They will happily prepare half versions of all dishes, including entrees. This is fresh, aromatic, mouth-watering food. Refuse the bread & olive oil, and order the house made, grilled pita!

We had: Feta sto Fourno-Greek feta baked in tomato, capers, and brandy...need I say more? Smear the feta and sauce on your pita, eat, and allow the yummy sounds to resonate your immediate pleasure!

Kolokithokeftethes-zucchini cakes with mint, cucumber-yogurt dressing. This is not your typical Greek restaurant food. The cool of the yogurt dressing with the warm and flavorful zucchini cakes is one of those perfect combinations. The Greek wine was perfect with everything, and we so enjoyed trying something new!

I am a vegetarian, and my friend a hearty carnivore and this is the perfect combination of both. He got a half order of Arnisia Paidakia-lamb chops & potatoes while I had the Spanakotiropita-and don't think, unless you have been to Greece that you have had this dish before. I have had it many times, and made it, and this was truly fabulous. The herbs, as with all of the dishes, were fresh and full of flavor. This is the quintessential mnu where flavors not only marry, but they dance together on your palate.

The place got too busy, and we waited too long for dessert. They apologized, & served us a delectable plate of Greek cookies and a dessert wine on the house.

They love what they do, and it is obvious. 

We can't wait to return!!

#Aprondiaries

Classy decor, pricey menu and exclusive clientele go there. You have to make reservations long in advance. Is it worth it? If you have don't mind the expense and like ambiance go for it. 

I have been here several times and came most recently with my friend. The food is always consistently amazing as it is the service. The appetizers are so fantastic that we did not even order an entrée. The decor is very upscale warm and cozy. Even the bathrooms in the basement that you take an elevator to get to are impressive. They have a private room downstairs that I hope one day to utilize for a special occasion. As usual I can't wait to return.

Besides delicious woos fire roasted lamb, they have tasty fish and traditional Greek appetizers. The service was very attentive without being obtrusive. It is possible to have a serious discussion there with colleagues. Everyone will be in a good mood.

Went to this place for Dinner and I wasn't let down! Beautiful up scale place with a nice and romantic ambience. 

Ordered some wine and:
Kalamata Pita which is a flatbread with olives,mushrooms,some cheese which tasted ok.
Crispy Zucchini Cakes topped with perfectly blended mint yogurt were awesome! Something which I never ate before but wont mind eating them again ( though they are fried :D )
Makaronia-which was a super delicious Ravioli.
Dessert was a Dark Choc Cake called Sokolatina which was real good as well!

Service was outstanding,very professional and friendly.
Quite Expensive but I can always come back for the Zucchini Cakes :D

One of the Best in SF! Must try.

Sorry for not being able to upload any photos although i highly recommend Kokkari Estiatorio- great location, amazing anbience not to forget the warm welcome of the staff and the food which was simply a unique experience - a must try for anyone visiting SF. Cheers !

If you like great food then this is a must! We had to book 3 weeks in advance but absolutely worth it. On the pricey side but the restaurant doesn't pretend to cater otherwise. Was about $120 for dinner + wine for 2. Fantastic service!

We had the goat ragout, muossaka and a chicken souvva that was amazing. No room for dessert but hoping to be back soon!
Outstanding but expensive greek food. One of the best restaurants in SF. Everything is good here, and very authentic. The highlights are the grilled meats.

Excellent San Francisco experience. The decor of the place is quite beautiful with lots of seating available and an earthen-ware kitchen quality vibe. The yogurt and sweet beets was fresh and delicious. The slow rotisserie lamb was perfectly cooked as well as the potatoes. There wasn't too much salt or sugar in the meal. The dessert was mint yogurt with strawberry sorbet and was a knock-out. It was so well balanced that the mouth waters extra with each mouthful. Those living in San Francisco have a good place to go to. Being from Canada the prices are outstanding for this type of restaurant and quality. Highly recommended!

My Favorite Restaurant. The location of Kokkari is the exact footprint of my previous favorite restaurant, Ciao! This Greek restaurant is just so good, you can't find a better restaurant in all of SF. Enter by the large open fireplace with chickens roasting, setting the stage for the rich decor and lively vibe anytime of the day or evening. Waiters are always on, ready to make your dining experience seamless. The menu is amazing. Oh, and have the hot fudge sundae, you will dream about it for weeks.

Absolutely delicious!!!. Wow, what a great meal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Service was outstanding, very professional and extremely attentive. We ate the rotisserie of the day - spring lamb. It was one of the best meals I have ever had. This place is a true gem and I would recommend it to anyone living or traveling to San Fran.
I eat here every night while on vacation. It was 10+ every night. The flavour and taste was so good. When you want the best.
Amazing food!. Simply amazing food and ambiance. I just wish they were located in NC!

What a wonderful dining experience !. The absolute beauty of the restaurant was only surpassed by the wonders of this great greek dining experience. best restaurant we've ever eaten at in san francisco.
and to top off the great atmosphere and food our waiter was just tremendous.

Homey high-end. This place has been a favorite on dining sites since it opened. The atmosphere is warm and the food is tasty. Many plates lend themselves to sharing, so you can try a number of items during your visit. My one complaint is they don't vary the menu and many of the dishes have similar spices.
Grilled Octopus highly recommended. Lentil soup is also excellent.

Kokkari Wine List Review. We have eaten at this restaurant on several occasions. Most notably, my wife put together a surprise birthday celebration for me at Kokkari when I turned 40. We sat in the main room near the kitchen at a long table that was able to accommodate 24+ people. It was a great evening of eating and drinking. The food and atmosphere are excellent, and the wine list is creative and diverse with reasonable mark-ups.

As with all of VinoServant reviews, you will see the price at the restaurant followed by the mark-up over retail (2008 Schramsberg Blanc de Noirs | $75 | 2.3x). Mark up of 2.3x translates into an average retail price of $32.

-----08 Mar, 2012-----
Kokkari Wine List Review

We have eaten at this restaurant on several occasions. Most notably, my wife put together a surprise birthday celebration for me at Kokkari when I turned 40. We sat in the main room near the kitchen at a long table that was able to accommodate 24+ people. It was a great evening of eating and drinking. Besides some great wines off Kokkari's list, my father-in-law brought along a double magnum of 1985 Sterling Vineyards, Three Palms Vineyard (55% Merlot and 45% Cabernet Sauvignon). The food and atmosphere are excellent, and the wine list is creative and diverse with reasonable mark-ups. 

We recommend you start your evening with the 2009 Bedrock, Cuvee Caritas, Sonoma County White Wine for $40 or the 2009 Kinston Family, Casablanca Valley, Sauvignon Blanc for $32 and follow it up with the 2008 Freeman, Russian River Valley, Pinot Noir for $55 or the 2006 Bridesmaid, Napa Valley, Cabernet Sauvignon for $48.

As with all VinoServant reviews, you will see the price at the restaurant followed by the mark-up over retail (2007 Schramsberg, Blanc de Noirs, North Coast | $75 | 2.5x | This translates into a retail price of $30).

Late reservation, worth the wait. First choice for dinner fell through, took a friend's recommendation and made late reservations. Decor is a stunning recreation of a old greek kitchen, complete with wood burning hearth grilling meat and bread (delicious). Corkage fee was $20. Waiter was attentive with great suggestions. Zucchini cakes and lamb meatball appetizers were full of flavor and cooked perfectly. Wood grilled pork 3 ways (someone rendered the fat into a 12" pork rind) w/ fingerling potatoes. If you only drink you coffee black, you will love greek coffee (expresso filtered through sand!!). I have never had ice cream with baklava before, but praline was a perfect match. Berry tart was superb. The best meal I've had all month.
Unequivocally FANTASTIC!! Ten people, each had something different. Everything without exception was excellent. Amazing service! Friendly, knowledgeable staff, great food!

I've been to this restaurant several times and it is consistently wonderful. Today was no exception. Chicken Souvlaki was tender and flavorful. My companion raved about the butternut squash ravioli. Make a resevation ahead of time for lunch as well as dinner as it is very popular.

Roasted Pork Souvlaki. Kokkari has long been a favorite of mine, both at the bar and in the main dining room. The lamb riblets are to die for. But I want to focus on one of their recent lunch specials, Pork Souvlaki-pita. The pork was being roasted on the spit for lunch that day and looked and smelled amazing. As the souvlaki pita was the special, it seemed the natural thing to order. The lamb and chicken souvlaki are regular menu items for lunch. 

I almost take for granted that the pork would be cooked properly roasting on a spit for hours and it was. What stood out was the pita. Not a flimsy paper thin piece of dry bread, but a wonderfully fresh, thick and seasoned compliment to the pork. Inside the Wrap of Life was thinly sliced red union, tzatziki, and tomato. The pita was presented initially with a large 'skewer' of rosemary to hold the wrapped pita's shape. The pita held its shape with each and every bite, even after I put it back on the plate. As will commonly happen with a variety of pedestrian street offerings of souvlaki pita, a foil wrap is the only thing keeping your lunch from making a mess of your clothes. Make no mistake, the souvlaki was moist from the pork and condiments and had a generous ooze from the bottom of the pita.

I look forward to trying their lamb and chicken varieties.
The Best Octopus. Kakkari served the best octopus I have ever tasted and I have tried in many places across the country.

Consistency!. For years, I have eaten at Kokkari, and year in year out it is quality, service and good food. It's one of the few restaurants in town where I can go alone, after working late, sidle up to the bar, and have a spectacular meal just from the appetizer menu! And the bartenders call me by name! Some of my most memorable SF meals have been at Kokkari!

Make a reservation because it is almost always packed. The food is well-prepared and departs from strict traditional cuisine just enough to provide tasty twists to classic dishes. At over $100 for two people (not including drinks) it is pricey but well worth it.

My Birthday at Kokkari with my hubby. I want to experience upscale Greek, Dress Up and enjoy the Luxurious Setting. I and my hubby pick the Kokkari Estiatorio Restaurant. 
( My hubby suggested this place to me. He has been here quite a few times with his coworkers )

When We walk in the door at Kokkari, There is splendidly romantic and beautiful with interior detail and texture.
The decor and ambiance is cozy , charming .
I felt relax in big comfortable arm chair.

I did order Salad But I prefer my hubby's soup, Test was delicious, smooth.
my salad is
Kokkari Salata - mixed seasonal lettuces chopped with feta, herbs & red wine vinaigrette 
My hubby ordered
Avgolemono - traditional egg-lemon soup with chicken & rice . It's so yummy!!!!!!!

We had Appetizers. Oh! I love both of them. I just can say " Wow..wwwwwwww "
Octopodaki tou Yiorgou - grilled octopus with lemon, oregano, & olive oil 
Somehow grilled octopus and salted with ouzo taste better when eaten by sea.
Garides Yuvetsi - wood oven roasted prawns with tomato & feta cheese 

When in Greece, Eat lamb, So we did. There was an amazing.!!!!!!
Our main course was lamp chops; Lamb chops cooked so tender, juicy, fantastic. My lamps were so great. But I forgot to order medium well. then I had medium like my darling. So I gave only 4.5 stars for this plate.
Arnisia Paidakia - grilled lamb chops with a lemon-oregano vinaigrette & Kokkari potatoes 


Dessert is something to look forward to at Kokkari.=)'

Yiaourti Granita - Yogurt sorbet with seasonal fruit granita & mint syrup 
A lovely yogurt sorbet with a granita is a lighter option.

Galaktoboureko - Traditional semolina custard in filo with warm quince spoon sweet & lemon-sage ice cream 
Pastry flutes filled with lemony semolina custard. It is not overly sweet. It's just perfect!!!!

* Kokkari's prices reflect this aspiration. Dinner for us reached $250, for two wines, two appetizers, two entrees, two desserts, If you're on a budget. The service was friendly . And Kokkari is romantic and beautiful place. Oh!!! I just can say I really like this place. *
